law.catch_line: Right of aggrieved person to apply for administrative hearing -- Appeal from final order to Franklin Circuit Court.

text.section: Any person aggrieved by the entry of an order by the commissioner under this subtitle may file written application for an administrative hearing.
The written application for a hearing under this subtitle shall be made in good faith and shall state the reasons or grounds the person is so aggrieved and the remedy sought at the hearing.
Any application for a hearing under this subtitle shall be filed with the commissioner within twenty (20) days of the date of the order.

If the commissioner finds that the application for a hearing is made in good faith, and that the applicant would be aggrieved as claimed if his or her grounds are established, then a hearing shall be held in accordance with KRS Chapter 13B.
An appeal from the commissioner shall be taken only from a final order.
The appeal from a final order issued by the commissioner shall be granted as a matter of right to the Franklin Circuit Court.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 855, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 247, sec. 27, effective April 24, 2006.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/12/2006). This section was created in 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 247 as a new section of KRS Chapter 366A. Sec. 38 of that same bill also required that all sections of KRS Chapters 287, 288, 290, 291, 294, 366, 366A, and 368 be renumbered as sections of a single KRS chapter entitled the "Kentucky Financial Services Code." Therefore, the Statute Reviser, acting under KRS 7.136(1), has codified this section as a new section of KRS Chapter 286.
